DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Mass Tumor Level Prostate Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the site (apex, middle, base) within the prostate zonal anatomy used to identify the location of the tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._The measure of a  tumor marker in a given sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: The measure of a  tumor marker in a given sample.

Concepts.definition: The amount of a tumor marker in a given sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda).  11/20/19 jk created for CPTAC PRAD baseline CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm that affects the prostate gland.  Representative examples include benign prostate phyllodes tumor, prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia, prostate carcinoma, and prostate sarcoma._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper, smaller part of the prostate between the ejaculatory ducts and the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The upper, smaller part of the prostate between the ejaculatory ducts and the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Uppermost part of the prostate gland.

Concepts.definition: The lowest part of the prostate gland adjacent to the superior fascia of the urogenital diaphragm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The uppermost part of the prostate gland adjacent to the bladder wall.

Concepts.definition: The uppermost part of the prostate gland adjacent to the bladder wall.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
Named locations of or within the body.
